title: Comparative Analysis of Springboard Diving Training Environments: Strategy Development Through Kinematic Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners possess expert-level domain knowledge and perform projects analyzing actual diving training data to identify differences between two environments

learning_goals: Learners can compare kinematic data from backward-rotation dives performed in two training environments (land/water) and identify at least three key differences (board work, jump height, etc.).
Learners can mathematically model and propose optimal training strategies based on kinematic analysis results, tailored to different environments.
Learners can apply statistical methods to verify similarities in joint coordination patterns through pattern recognition in large datasets.

resources: Wireless Network Infrastructure for BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Environment Support

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
